data.title: GG18 - Climate Round
data.description: Grants in this round are primarily focused on climate solutions (the group may do other work, but the grant proposal must be directly related to climate solutions). The projects are explicitly helping to reduce GHGs, and/or serve as an important core infrastructure for web3 climate solution

Open call from all community members and projects to nominate representatives to talk about data concerns. Round-table discussions on data privacy and data ownership. Co-designing our data policy. We're aiming to have at least one representative from each continent.

data.reason:
We have created novel visualisations and features for the Green Globe (gainforest.app). A full walkthrough can be found here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQdNGw_7iaw

Specifically we:
- Integrated new geospatial layers (e.g global canopy height, average temperature, ...)
- Integrated drone close-up imagery
- Canopy delineation visualisation
- Species richness and Restor integration
- Phylogenetic visualisations

data.title: Exploring Hypercerts for Nature Stewards
data.description: We explored the use of Hypercerts as a tool for our community partners who are nature stewards. This included discussions with VoiceDeck to understand how they are adopting Hypercerts for journalists. The concept was introduced during two of our monthly community calls, followed by separate one-on-one sessions with interested community partners to guide them on how to participate.

data.name: Hypercerts
data.description:
This round aims to strengthen the Hypercerts Ecosystem to realize the vision of an interconnected impact funding network. We specifically want to support projects
1. that integrate hypercerts into existing funding platforms—similar to the hypercerts integration with Gitcoin,
2. that develop new applications like prize competitions leveraging the hypercerts infrastructure,
3. that build tooling to extent the functionality for multiple integrations and applications, such as Deresy to coordinate evaluators, or
4. that are tangible use cases piloting new functionalities, e.g. implementing retroactive funding rounds with hypercerts or using hyperboards.

Our project was selected to be part of the [GG20 Celo Public Goods Climate Bonus Round](https://mirror.xyz/celopg.eth/McicejfzasLM0nD5HKNdPukgQHvVrRVT2GiFwwzf8AA).

### **Celo Claim:**

Your project uses the Celo Network to coordinate its operations (such as cStable payments, a Celo SAFE, Celo Hypercerts etc...)

- We pay community members from around the world using Celo (cUSD), using the Valora wallet. For additional proof, all transactions are displayed on our GainForest transparency platform. Attached below is a short video of the transactions, as well as a blogpost documenting our measure-to-earn program:

https://gainforest.substack.com/p/what-is-gainforests-measure-to-earn

- We plan to have all transactions referenced in a Celo attestation expressing the motive of the transaction. So far, a portion of the transactions are already visible here: https://celo.easscan.org/address/0x00da1b2D16c777D8Be7656C6780d23a98292c0ee

- We have minted and plan to continue minting hypercerts to illustrate the environmental work done by a particular project. Link to the related hypercert from the "Oceanus Conservation" project above: https://hypercerts.org/app/view?claimId=0x16ba53b74c234c870c61efc04cd418b8f2865959-3743106036130323098097120681749450326016

[Screen Recording 2024-05-07 at 13.59.47.mov](https://storage.tally.so/private/Screen-Recording-2024-05-07-at-13.59.47.mov?id=2aBNjV&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6IjJhQk5qViIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTA4Mzc5OH0.Fi0uN4CmbmigSbSWP3Wyc-rB3zPtnuUBfOynCMW5T_I&signature=edb7c2a56afc5dcf7b42edb12adf8f28228bbc01f37f788f5a6f19392487687a) - - -

data.description: Community members receive Conservation Data Income by collecting environmental data (audio recordings, drone flights, contributing insights to "Taina", our friendly telegram bot). They are paid for their work - 1 cent per audio minute, 5 cents per MB of drone data, and up to $1 for each Taina insight.

data.title: Deploy Polly: AI assistant for climate negotiators
data.description: One of Polly’s major goals is to make it easier for local and global decision-makers to incorporate IPLCs perspectives into environmental policy. This year, in 2024, we will continue to deploy Polly in the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) COP29 in Baku and United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) COP16 in Riyadh through our partnership with the Youth Negotiators Network.

data.reason: Polly has been successfully deployed in the UNCCD COP16 in Saudi Arabia.
Polly has been successfully deployed in the UNCCD COP16 in Saudi Arabia.

data.text: We welcomed four new community partners: Bula Garden Tanzania, Blue Carbon Tanzania, Darukaa Earth, and Climatica Foundation. As on-the-ground nature stewards, we’re happy to support them with decentralized science, equitable tech, and Web3 funding opportunities.
data.title: Onboarded 4 New Community Partners

data.name: DeSci on Gitcoin
data.description: Desci community on Gitcoin

questions.query: How does your project support the mission or goals of DeSci?
questions.explanation:
We give out DeSci grants and capacity building workshops to our local and Indigenous scientists.

Some of these models in community co-production can rival the state-of-the-art models, such as our canopy delineation algorithm for dense rainforests.

questions.query: Describe how funds from the grants program will be used for your project.
questions.explanation: We will expand our Indigenous and local scientists program by starting with the local Amazonian communities and South East Asian communities. The tools that will be developed will be used to strengthen the web3 grants ecosystem, especially in ReFi.

data.text:
We created platforms to engage individuals outside the nature stewardship community, including those in decentralized science and Web3.  

- A [collaborative hub](https://gainforest.notion.site/GainForest-Collaborative-Hub-12094a2f76b38011872bcbb08d58522a) was set up to consolidate existing resources. Members are encouraged to share additional resources, such as off-ramping strategies in different countries.  
- A [Telegram group](https://t.me/+8RhyehxxATlkNDZl) called "Friends of GainForest" was established to foster collaboration and knowledge-sharing among these new supporters.
data.title: Created Platforms for Friends of GainForest

data.text: We developed Impact Trace, a tool that allows community partners to create polygons of their conservation sites. To support its use, we created a tutorial video, which was shared during the November Community Call to help partners understand how to use the tool effectively.
data.title: Created Impact Trace

data.text: We trained four field officers from Oceanus Conservation on deploying AudioMoths for bioacoustic data collection in Cagwait, Philippines. The field officers shared their knowledge with local fishermen, teaching them to use the devices effectively. The fishermen, in return, provided valuable insights on adapting the devices to local conditions, enriching our understanding of community-driven approaches.
data.title: Bioacoustics data collection with Oceanus

data.text:
We conduct monthly community calls where our community members can share knowledge from in the field.

September 30th 2024: In our September Community Call, Oceanus Conservation from the Philippines shared their experience deploying AudioMoths to collect bioacoustic data. This was a skill they learned during our fieldwork with them early September. We invited them to teach other community members about their deployment experience in mangrove areas. As a token of appreciation for their contribution, we provided them with a payment.

October 31st 2024: In the October Community Call, we invited Rodrigo, a local champion from Manaus, Brazil, to share his technical expertise in using drones for conservation. His presentation sparked interest among several community partners, who are now exploring the potential of drones for their own conservation efforts.

November 30 2024: In the November Community Call, we invited Jaya from Darukaa Earth to share their experience deploying AudioMoths in the Sundarban mangrove forest in India. They discussed best practices, challenges faced, and insights gained, providing valuable learnings for other community partners.
data.title: Monthly Environmental dMRV Skill-Sharing Calls

data.text: Collaborated with GainForest local champion, Julius Silah to develop a crypto-to-fiat withdrawal guide for community partners in Kenya. The [guide](https://gainforest.notion.site/Off-ramping-Guides-by-Country-15394a2f76b380078697c6ac3d02faa4) is now available for others to reference.
data.title: Co-Created Offramp Guide for Kenyan Partners

data.text: We assisted COBEC, one of our community partners, with withdrawing funds from Gitcoin Grants #GG21. As they were new to Web3, we guided them via video calls and handled the swaps to prevent errors. A 1% fee was applied to cover gas fees, and we used Opera MiniPay for the transaction.
data.title: Guided COBEC (Kenya) in Fund Withdrawal for #GG21

data.text: We provided one-on-one guidance to Bees and Trees and SORALO, community partners in Kenya, to help them successfully withdraw funds from Gitcoin Grants #GG22. To avoid errors, we handled the swaps on their behalf, as they were new to Web3. A 1% fee was charged to cover the gas fees. In the process, we also introduced them to and utilized the MiniPay Wallet.
data.title: Guided Community Fund Withdrawal for #GG22

data.text: We opened consultation hours to support community partners in learning about Gitcoin Grants and how to secure funding through it. A comprehensive guide was created to support them in the process. Five community partners attended individual consultation sessions, eight applied to #GG22 (Ma Earth: Land Regenerators Round), and two successfully got accepted and participated in the donation round.
data.title: Launched the 'Road to Gitcoin' Accelerator

data.name: Ma Earth
data.description: Ma Earth is a community-led movement to align economic incentives with planetary health and regeneration.

**Impact Quadratic Funding (IQF) for Conservation Data Income**

Impact Quadratic Funding (IQF) is a breakthrough enhancement to traditional quadratic funding that solves the "marketing problem" in public goods funding while leveraging Celo's blockchain infrastructure to support verified conservation efforts. By introducing impact verification into the core QF matching formula, IQF ensures matching funds are allocated based on actual conservation outcomes rather than marketing spend.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Our work has created significant ripple effects throughout the open-source ecosystem, particularly at the intersection of Web3 and environmental sustainability:

![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3A5736d1c3-15a1-4807-bfe0-5181ae73b003%3AScreenshot_2025-03-28_at_1.37.49_PM.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-8033-8563-f1f03c657cf7&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=2000&userId=&cache=v2)

**Ecosystem Growth Through Ecocerts**

In partnership with Hypercerts Foundation, we built and maintain [EcoCertain](https://www.ecocertain.xyz/), the premier Web3 environmental hypercerts platform. This has successfully onboarded dozens of conservation projects from remote global communities into the Web3 space. Our platform has directly enabled multiple partner communities to secure funding through [Gitcoin](https://gainforest.notion.site/Gitcoin-Grants-d0e1286feae448fb91f01f2f7c965bc7), Ma Earth, and Octant grant programs.

**Standards Adoption & Protocol Expansion**

The Ecocerts framework we developed has achieved widespread adoption across the regenerative finance sector, becoming integrated into key organizations including:
- ReFi DAO
- Kolektivo
- Ma Earth
- Celo's Ultragreen Money Initiative

![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3A2891df10-9aa2-49da-99a3-ecf3ddda5ce6%3AScreenshot_2025-03-28_at_1.38.02_PM.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-8016-81bc-dc8f1b9aebfe&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

**Pioneering On-Chain Impact Verification**

GainForest stands as one of the first projects to implement on-chain impact evaluation, creating a model that:
- Leverages decentralized storage infrastructure on Filecoin
- Demonstrates transparent donation tracking on Celo
- Has directly influenced the deployment of key protocols (EAS, Splits, and Hypercerts) on the Celo network

**Innovation in Funding Mechanisms**

Using our impact data, we've pioneered [ImpactQF](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/citizen-grants-gcp-impact-passports-and-impact-quadratic-funding-impactqf/19712/5), a novel funding distribution mechanism that has been adopted across multiple Gitcoin rounds, including the Hypercerts Round and Regen Coordination events.

This work collectively expands the OSS ecosystem by creating reusable frameworks, demonstrating real-world applications of Web3 technologies for environmental impact, and developing new coordination tools that benefit the broader open-source community. All of this led us to win Web3’s first [XPRIZE](https://app.hypercerts.org/hypercerts/42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-31305977756726338638630463883722675453952).

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
### 📍 [EcoCertain](https://ecocertain.xyz)
![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3A03cf7413-d71e-4876-aba5-06ec2f06983c%3AScreenshot_2025-03-28_at_1.38.17_PM.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-8020-932e-ccb128a72e60&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

Core Features:

- **Environmental Hypercerts Issuance:** Enables conservation projects to tokenize their environmental impact as verifiable hypercerts on the blockchain.
- **Remote Community Onboarding:** Specialized workflow for bringing conservation efforts from remote global communities into Web3, with minimal technical barriers.
- **Impact Verification Framework:** Transparent system for validating and quantifying environmental outcomes. We leverage EAS attestations to connect the ecocert with real-world data such as geospatial polygons.
- **Funding Access Integration:** Direct pathways for verified projects to access grant opportunities through Celo Ultragreen Money.

### 📍 [Green Globe](https://www.gainforest.app)
![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3Abbf8badd-3569-41be-afc2-90f8c7dc89f9%3AScreenshot_2025-03-28_at_1.38.28_PM.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-80ee-a093-fb6868f86cd5&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

Core Features:
- **Geospatial Impact Visualization:** Interactive map-based interface showing conservation activities and their verified outcomes
- **Carbon and Biodiversity Metrics:** Quantification and visualization of multiple environmental impact categories including carbon sequestration and biodiversity preservation.
- **Donation Transparency:** On-chain tracking of funds from donation through to verified impact, providing complete transparency for donors.
- **Community Engagement Tools:** Features that allow supporters to directly interact with and follow specific conservation projects.
- **Impact Documentation System:** Infrastructure for field teams to easily document and verify conservation activities using mobile-friendly interfaces.

### Key Differentiators
1. **Bridge Between Traditional Conservation and Web3:** Unlike most crypto projects, we've created practical onramps for established conservation organizations with minimal crypto experience. See: [Info Hub for GainForest Community Partners](https://gainforest.notion.site/Info-Hub-for-GainForest-Community-Partners-cbfbb5c733834571ad358db0860c8382)
2. **Bottom-up Approach:** While most environmental platforms focus on large institutional projects, we specialize in empowering grassroots initiatives led by indigenous and local communities.
3. **Field-tested Implementation:** Our platforms are built based on direct experience working with conservation projects in challenging environments, ensuring practical usability rather than theoretical applications.
4. **Interoperability Focus:** Designed from the ground up to work within the broader regen Web3 ecosystem, creating compatibility with emerging standards rather than siloed solutions (e.g., [Formalizing Impact Claims for Ecocerts Interoperability](https://github.com/hypercerts-org/ecocerts/issues/3)).

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3Ac181d140-b416-4eb1-85fc-65f3741db623%3Aecocerteco.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-80b0-b424-c57cf782964a&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

Our primary focus is to expand the Ecocerts standard by building a comprehensive impact measurement and multi-layered attestation system as illustrated in the diagram. Specifically, we plan to:

1. **Develop a Robust Attestation Layer**
- Create infrastructure for multiple verification sources to provide attestations on a single impact claim
- Implement conflict resolution protocols when attestations differ (as shown in the Species Richness conflict in the diagram)
- Build verification hierarchies with trusted attestors who can validate impact claims

2. **Expand Data Integration Capabilities**
- Connect bioacoustic monitoring systems for biodiversity verification
- Integrate drone imagery analysis for tree planting verification
- Develop APIs for satellite data integration to monitor land restoration

3. **Enhance the Verification Dashboard**
- Create visual interfaces showing verification status across all claims
- Implement a transparent scoring system for confidence levels in each attestation
- Build tools for comparing self-reported metrics against verified outcomes

### Grant Fund Allocation
![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3A37269cb6-a1e5-40a3-846f-43a8dbad25b0%3AScreenshot_2025-03-28_at_2.37.28_PM.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-801d-a3af-dce8a9df5cf9&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
👥 **Community Growth**
- Onboard 100 new communities into the GainForest network
- Create Web3 onboarding programs and educational resources  for nature stewards
- Expand community-led [data council](https://gainforest.gitbook.io/docs/community/gainforest-data-council) initiatives
- Continue hosting [monthly community calls](https://gainforest.gitbook.io/docs/community/monthly-community-calls) for knowledge exchange and peer-sharing

🛠️ **Technical Infrastructure**
- Launch the first version of [ImpactQF](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/citizen-grants-gcp-impact-passports-and-impact-quadratic-funding-impactqf/19712/5)
- Launch new version of the [Green Globe](https://gainforest.app) 
- Launch [Tainá](https://gainforest.gitbook.io/docs/solutions/ai-assistants/taina) v2 - Indigenous-owned AI assistant
- Launch [Polly](https://gainforest.gitbook.io/docs/solutions/ai-assistants/polly) v2 beta - climate policy AI assistant
- Implement splits contract for reward distribution (The Nature Guild)
- Create community participation platform (e.g., in Charmverse)

[Ecocertain Platform](https://ecocertain.xyz)
- Develop multi-source attestation layer for impact claims
- Implement conflict resolution protocols for attestations
- Build verification hierarchies with trusted attestors
- Integrate bioacoustic, drone and satellite monitoring
- Create verification dashboard with confidence scoring
- Build self-reported vs. verified outcomes comparison tools

![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3Ac181d140-b416-4eb1-85fc-65f3741db623%3Aecocerteco.png?table=block&id=1c494a2f-76b3-80b0-b424-c57cf782964a&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

🏛️ **Governance** ([The Nature Guild](https://gainforest.gitbook.io/docs/solutions/the-nature-guild))
- Establish community-driven governance structure
- Create transparent documentation for all decision-making processes
- Implement participation incentives and rewards system
- Develop clear voting and resource allocation mechanisms

![alt text](https://gainforest.notion.site/image/attachment%3A4a1cbcd3-f9ad-4218-ab77-57fe6a4700a6%3Aboundaries.png?table=block&id=1c894a2f-76b3-80d6-b4eb-d42fa8b9c6b7&spaceId=592f10fa-b2fe-4de7-84d7-d47ef5244493&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

🔐 **Privacy & Security**
- Implement ZK Identity for community verification
- Develop ZK Data Proofs for environmental monitoring
- Integrate privacy-preserving validation solutions

📣 **Events & Capacity-building**
- Organize first local hackathon in the Amazon (Brazil)
- Train youth negotiators to use Polly v2 at COP30 
- Host regional environmental AI training workshops

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

milestones.title: Promote funding Impactful Regenerative Projects
milestones.description:
Ecocertain is an impact-first initiative dedicated to saving nature and supporting those who do. The core idea of this platform revolves around showcasing and managing what we call Ecocerts. Ecocerts are hypercerts with a special eco-purpose—that is, hypercerts that represent environmental impact. With Ecocerts, this platform enables you to:

**As a funder:**
Support projects managed by local communities at the grassroots level to protect nature. And it’s not just a donation—it’s more than that. What you receive in return is impact ownership, because when you contribute, you’re actually acquiring a share of the Ecocert. The greater the share of the Ecocert you purchase, the greater the share of the impact you hold.

**As a community member:**
Create projects that are prominently displayed on the platform. These projects are Ecocerts at their core. When you create an Ecocert, you provide proof of the work your community has done and the impact it has achieved. In return, you receive direct funding from funders.

# What’s Special
Every step you take on the platform or dApp is designed to make you feel as though you’re engaging with something inspired by nature—not just a tech platform. Nature is never abrupt, and your experience here mirrors that: every change in the interface is smoothly transitioned to feel natural.

One more thing: No matter who you are, you can easily become a funder or a contributor on this platform—because nature doesn’t ask for privileges.

milestones.title: Proof of Impact
milestones.description:
In our dApp, we use attestations for
1. for the project owner to attest proof of impact to a project
2. the feature where users can come over and add a review for a project

We plan to add the following features to the dApp:
1. increase the authenticity of an attestation by displaying if the user is verified on self.
2. display the country of the user attesting
3. add a quick link to user's self.xyz profile
